div.p: hi everyone I'm talking about a project
that I worked on called I have been
working on called gender Avenger that's
focused on measuring women's inclusion
in the public dialogue this is sort of
the information about gender Avenger the
mission is to build a community that
ensures women are represented in the
public dialogue it was started by
someone who friend of my Gina glance who
worked for a long time at seiu and
generally has been really involved in
politics one of the big things there are
two main things that gender Avenger does
one is we sort of highlight when women
are not sufficiently included in
different sorts of things so here's an
example where Esquire did a list of 80
Beck's books every man should read and
79 of them were written by men and so
gender Avenger put together this chart
using the g8 ally app this is sort of my
contribution and tweeted it at s square
a lot and encourage their supporters to
comment on the article saying and
suggest like female authors that should
have been included and it actually
worked asghar apologized and then as it
says here worked with eight female
literacy powerhouses to come up with a
new list that was much more even so this
is sort of a general thing the g8 ally
app is available to everyone and there's
an app you can download or it works
online and you can share it on Facebook
or Twitter or if you're worried that
you'll get in trouble for with work
because it's sort of a sensitive place
where you shouldn't be calling people
out there's also an option to have us
tweet it for you so that you don't have
to get in trouble the other thing that
gender Avenger does is to ask people to
take the gender Avenger pledge basically
promising not to be on panels that have
no women on them and there's a big long
list of people and you should totally
pick take the pledge and there's some
ongoing stuff they're ramping up now to
adopt the g8 Ally for use by groups that
focus on racial equality and also I
think it would be really cool to combine
this with our men talking too much
because this was largely around
conferences and it would be really cool
like measure how many men women are on a
given panel and then also measure how
much people are talking on those panels
so or at least like feature it on our
website so yeah that's it thanks
[Applause]
